content.raw:
We recognized after a test run on our local docker container, that we were able to report an Artifact although the base\_station was not in the neighbors list! 

A Robot was standing on the staging area all the time and did get the base\_station in the neighbors list not before the reporting of the first artifact which was done at 117 seconds simulation time. 

If this occurs only at the beginning of the simulation, we can live with it. But if this will also occur late on, the neighbors list cannot be used and is misleading!
content.html:
We recognized after a test run on our local docker container, that we were able to report an Artifact although the base_station was not in the neighbors list!

A Robot was standing on the staging area all the time and did get the base_station in the neighbors list not before the reporting of the first artifact which was done at 117 seconds simulation time.

If this occurs only at the beginning of the simulation, we can live with it. But if this will also occur late on, the neighbors list cannot be used and is misleading!
